text: Hello! I'm trying to add HubSpot as an OAuth provider to my web app. I've successfully retrieved an access token and can use it to query the API, but I can't find any endpoint that returns the logged in user's profile data (name, email, avatar url etc.)
The `/integrations/v1/me` endpoint from the legacy API seemed promising, but that only returns a portalId and no user-specific data

Probably `/oauth/v1/access-tokens/{token}` is what I'm looking for. But I'm wondering, can the `user` field contain anything other than email? Should I do two requests? One to fetch the user id and then one to `/settings/v3/users/{user_id}` to fetch the actual email? Also, how can I fetch the name and the avatar url?

Hi <@U504BHZ6K>, a little late with a reply but I was helping another developer with a similar issue. The property label can be the same as the previous/deleted property's label but you can change the name of the internal property name to something different and it lets you create the property.
